statements: SELECT * FROM customer_demographics;
SELECT first_name, last_name, location FROM customer_demographics;
SELECT * FROM customer_demographics WHERE age > 30;
SELECT first_name, last_name, income FROM customer_demographics WHERE gender = 'F';
SELECT * FROM customer_demographics ORDER BY income DESC;
SELECT * FROM customer_demographics ORDER BY age DESC, income ASC
SELECT first_name, last_name, gender FROM customer_demographics WHERE age >= 30 AND gender='M'
SELECT location, income FROM customer_demographics WHERE income > 50000 ORDER BY location ASC, income DESC
SELECT first_name, last_name, age FROM customer_demographics WHERE gender='F' AND location LIKE '%York%'
SELECT customer_id, first_name, last_name, income FROM customer_demographics LIMIT 5
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT first_name, last_name FROM customers ORDER BY age DESC;
SELECT first_name, gender FROM customers WHERE age > 30;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE gender = 'Male';
SELECT segment_name, segment_description FROM marketing_segments;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY last_name ASC, first_name DESC;
SELECT first_name, last_name FROM customers WHERE gender = 'Female' ORDER BY last_name;
SELECT customer_id, first_name, last_name, age FROM customers JOIN marketing_segments ON customers.customer_id = marketing_segments.segment_id;
SELECT segment_name, segment_description FROM marketing_segments WHERE segment_id < 5;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE gender = 'Male' OR age < 25 ORDER BY age DESC;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name, age FROM customers WHERE age > 30;
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customers WHERE gender = 'F';
SELECT * FROM demographics ORDER BY income DESC;
SELECT segment_name, segment_description FROM audience_segments;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE age > 30 AND gender = 'F';
SELECT customer_name, age, email FROM customers ORDER BY age DESC;
SELECT customers.customer_name, demographics.location FROM customers JOIN demographics ON customers.customer_id = demographics.customer_id WHERE demographics.income > 50000;
SELECT customer_name, gender, email FROM customers WHERE customer_name LIKE '%John%';
SELECT segment_name, segment_description FROM audience_segments;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name, age FROM customers WHERE gender = 'Male';
SELECT customer_name, location FROM customers ORDER BY location DESC;
SELECT segment_name, description FROM segments WHERE segment_id = 1;
SELECT campaign_name, end_date FROM campaigns WHERE start_date > '2022-01-01';
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY customer_name DESC;
SELECT customer_name, location FROM customers INNER JOIN segment_customers ON customers.customer_id = segment_customers.customer_id WHERE segment_id = 3;
SELECT DISTINCT gender FROM customers WHERE location = 'New York';

SELECT customer_name, segment_name FROM customers INNER JOIN segment_customers ON customers.customer_id = segment_customers.customer_id INNER JOIN segments ON segment_customers.segment_id = segments.segment_id ORDER BY segment_name, customer_name;

SELECT customer_name, segment_name FROM customers INNER JOIN segment_customers ON customers.customer_id = segment_customers.customer_id INNER JOIN segments ON segment_customers.segment_id = segments.segment_id WHERE segment_name LIKE 'VIP%';
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT name, age, gender FROM customers WHERE age > 30;
SELECT customer_id, location, ethnicity FROM demographics WHERE location = 'New York';
SELECT segment_name, description FROM segments ORDER BY segment_id DESC;
SELECT campaign_name, start_date, budget FROM marketing_campaigns WHERE budget > 10000 ORDER BY start_date;
SELECT * FROM customers ORDER BY age DESC, income ASC;
SELECT name, gender FROM customers WHERE age > 30 AND income > 50000;

SELECT c.name, d.location, s.segment_name FROM customers c JOIN demographics d ON c.customer_id = d.customer_id JOIN customer_segments cs ON c.customer_id = cs.customer_id JOIN segments s ON cs.segment_id = s.segment_id WHERE d.ethnicity = 'Asian';
SELECT * FROM demographics WHERE education_level IN ('High School', 'College') ORDER BY location;

SELECT cs.segment_id, s.segment_name, COUNT(*) AS customers_count FROM customer_segments cs JOIN segments s ON cs.segment_id = s.segment_id GROUP BY cs.segment_id, s.segment_name HAVING customers_count > 5;
